intro: Labordia baillonii, commonly known as the Baillon's labordia, is a rare flowering plant native to the southern regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Labordia baillonii is considered a species of conservation concern.
